books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.summary: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel by Harper Lee. It is a classic of modern American literature dealing with themes of racism and injustice.

books.author: George Orwell
books.summary: A dystopian novel set in a totalitarian society, where the government monitors and controls every aspect of human life.

books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.summary: A novel set in the Roaring Twenties, exploring themes of decadence, idealism, and the American Dream.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.summary: A classic romantic novel set in Georgian England, exploring themes of marriage, class, and social expectations.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.summary: A coming-of-age novel narrated by a disaffected teenager, Holden Caulfield, as he navigates the challenges of adolescence and society.

books.title: To the Lighthouse
books.author: Virginia Woolf
books.summary: A novel that explores the passage of time and the complexity of human relationships through the experiences of the Ramsay family.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.summary: An epic tale of Captain Ahab's obsessive quest for revenge against the white whale, Moby Dick.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.summary: A fantasy novel about the journey of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit who embarks on an adventure to reclaim the Lonely Mountain from the dragon Smaug.

books.title: The Grapes of Wrath
books.author: John Steinbeck
books.summary: A Pulitzer Prize-winning novel that tells the story of the Joad family, who are forced to leave their farm during the Great Depression and migrate to California in search of work.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.summary: A high-fantasy epic that follows the quest to destroy the One Ring, which threatens to enslave the world, undertaken by Frodo Baggins and his companions.
